intro: Prunus mutabilis f. lucida, commonly known as the white-flowered cherry or the Japanese white cherry, is a cultivar of the Prunus mutabilis species. It is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is a small deciduous tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of 3 to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth margin and a glossy green surface. The fruit is a small, sweet drupe that ripens in late summer, adding ornamental value to the plant.
